spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. AFTR+LPA is the default on RedPill and best for the battery life but if you have problems try Idle+LPA.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

seekBar.description: Sets the sched_mc value which changes the cpu scheduler behaviour for multi-cpu systems. 0 is Samsung kernel's default value which turns sched_mc off. Setting it to 1 means that the first core will be tried to be loaded more and setting it to 2 will bias task wake-ups to semi-idle cpu package for power savings. (default: 1)
seekBar.name: sched_mc

spinner.description: Sets the number of CPUs to be used in hotplugging. (Works only when pegasusq is selected as the default CPU governor)
spinner.name: Max CPU Lock

spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps. I've tried making the choice as simple as possible.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps. Deadline and SIO are both tweaked for a bias towards latency on flash based storage.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This is enabled by default to ensure the integrity of the files during I/O operations. Disabling it may give you a boost in I/O throughput at the expense of stability. You have been warned! That said, we don't expect any crashes and even if we do get one the bias towards latency + the tweaked mount options ensure you lose only 1 second worth of data at most.
spinner.name: FSync Control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Scoobydoo Sound (needs a reboot to take effect)
checkbox.name: Scoobydoo Sound
checkbox.label: Scoobydoo Sound

checkbox.description: Enable speaker tuning for better bass response on main speakers
checkbox.name: Speaker Tuning
checkbox.label: Speaker Tuning

seekBar.description: Speaker Amplification Offset. 0 means stock value. Having too much amplification may cause distortion.
seekBar.name: Speaker Amplification Offset

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplifier Level (0-63 which corresponds to -57db-6db)
seekBar.name: Headphone Amplifier

spinner.description: Choose which equalizer settings to use: Presets or Graphical Equalizer.
spinner.name: EQ Presets

seekBar.description: This will prevent distortion by decreasing the output volume by the selected amount. Leave it 0 if you do not have a distortion problem.
seekBar.name: Negative Digital Gain

settingsPane.description: Optimization, conversion quality, signal processing and effect settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

spinner.description: Tuned WM1811 FLL to generate clock source
spinner.name: FLL Tuning

spinner.description: For 48kHz sample rate, the DAC oversample rate is 128fs when this option is selected, which makes the music sound better.
spinner.name: DAC OverSampling

spinner.description: Bypass analog channel mixer and redirect the sound directly to the output.
spinner.name: dac direct

spinner.description: This forces the output to be mono even if the source is stereo
spinner.name: Force Mono

button.description: Back up the EFS partition. If you don't have a current backup I highly recommend to perform one as the risk of NOT having an EFS backup can be disastrous. This will create 2 backups in your /sdcard directory: efsbackup.tar.gz and efsdev-mmcblk0p3.img.gz (The former being a tar.gz of the entire /efs partition; the latter being an exact copy o the /efs partition in .img which is then gzipped to save space). If you ever need to restore your /efs any of the available tools to do so can use either of the 2 backups. Better safe than sorry.
button.name: Backup EFS
button.label: Backup EFS

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs a reboot to take effect)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger
